SurveyText: I believe that prescribed fire is a beneficial tool for managing rangelands.
People should be able to burn as frequently as they want for management.
Burning can be used in a limited set of instances.
My management plan includes using prescribed fire.
I am prepared to use prescribed fire if I choose to.
Fire should only be used by professionals.
Burning is a poor management option that shouldn’t be used.
Burning is a good option for anyone with training.
Prescribed use results in negative impacts on wildlife
Prescribed use results in soil erosion
Prescribed fire poses a risk to human safety
Prescribed fire poses a risk to nearby property
Prescribed use results in a loss of forage
My management decisions are based on scientific research or university publications.
My management decisions are based on how my neighbors manage their land.
Being a good steward of the land is important when I make management decisions.
My management decisions are based on what previous generations taught me.
My management decisions are based on advice of professionals (e.g., NRCS or Extension personnel).
I don’t have the proper training.
Prescribed fire is too time consuming.
I don’t feel like I understand prescribed fire well enough.
Legal liability I might face if my fire escaped is too great.
The necessary labor is not available to me.
Insurance is not available to me or is too costly.
The necessary equipment is not available to me.
I don’t think prescribed fire is cost effective.
Burn restrictions or burn bans limit my ability to use fire.
I believe that there should be more prescribed fire being used on public grazing lands.
I believe that there is an appropriate amount of prescribed fire being used on public grazing lands.
I think that public grazing land administrators should manage to meet user needs or preferences.
I think that public grazing land administrators should manage the land according to the best available science.
I think that public grazing land administrators do a good job managing the land.
I would support my neighbors’ burning on their land.
Local officials support prescribed fire in my community.
My neighbors would support me burning on my land.
My friends and family would support me burning my land
People in my community burn to manage their land.
In general, people in my community support prescribed fire use.
If you answered No above please rate the following statement: I would be interested in attending a workshop or program on prescribed fire use.
I have been/currently am a member of an association of fellow landowners (ex. Stockmen’s Association, Lamb and Wool Producers Association, Grazing Association)
